item.title: Manager- Data Analytics
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Manager- Data Analytics

Job Description

  • Obtain an in-depth understanding of HEF products and segments in order to effectively provide value-added insights
  • Build reporting that measures the success of new pricing strategies under Customized Pricing, measuring champion vs. challenger performance and make strategy recommendations
  • Utilize pricing optimization tool to create pricing proposal based on previous results and current rate environment.
  • Enhance the existing Tableau tools to incorporate on-going user feedback, deliver further efficiency through automation of processes and expose timely and relevant information to end-users
  • Work with the HEF Pricing team and others to advice on pricing decisions through use of reporting, leading edge analytics, measurement of key performance indicators, and early detection of trends & anomalies
  • Participate in building new predictive model to enable insights and facilitate pricing decision making process
  • Leverage data-driven tactics to provide key analytical and business insights to support senior leaders in managing the pricing strategy for the Home Equity portfolio
  • Create materials to communicate insights developed either through new reporting or specific stakeholder presentations and working sessions
  • Monitor the use of delegated pricing authorities to ensure compliance

Must-have  

  • 2-4 years of experience in an analytical and reporting capacity supporting a line of business across major Financial Institution(s).  
  • Strong analytical skills with the ability to interpret complex data and provide insights to senior management
  • SQL knowledge and experience, including developing and optimizing complex queries
  • Proficient in use of SAS, Tableau, Excel, PPT, or other data visualization tools
  • Self-starter—ability to work and think through problems and assignments in a self-directed manner
  • Excellent communication skills along with ability to partner effectively with and direct both internal and external partners

Nice-to-have

  • Passionate about the mortgage industry, and being part of a greater team
  • Knowledge of Data Science / predictive modelling / machine learning is an asset
  • Experience in Python and R programming
  • Knowledge of Linx, experience with RBC database and mortgage data  (only show on internal posting)

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

  • A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits, fair compensation, commissions, and stock where applicable
  • Leaders who help your development through coaching and managing opportunities
  • Ability to make a difference and lasting impact
  • Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team

Job Summary

RBC Home Equity Financing (HEF) is the leading lender of residential mortgages in Canada, and RBC’s single largest business with over $300 Billion in assets.
As the Manager, Data Analytics within HEF Pricing Team, you will use advanced analytics to provide senior leadership insights into the impacts of pricing strategies on the HEF portfolio. Also, you will maintain reporting package that focuses on the pricing aspect of the HEF business that will help drive key decisions with a high degree of impact. Furthermore, you will leverage pricing optimization tools to generate monthly pricing proposal under Customized Pricing strategies.

TORONTO, Ontario, Canada

Canada

item.title: Data Analytics Architect
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Data Analytics Architect

Job Description

RBC is a digitally-enabled relationship bank. We strive to engage our customers when, how and where it’s most convenient and to provide a highly-personalized experience. We also collaborate broadly with innovative business and technology partners to create a platform and ecosystem that can bring even more value to our customers. We care deeply about the success of our customers and communities.

We’re looking for an experienced solution architect who is passionate about our mission to join the RBC Digital team. We want vocal futurists that can advocate their vision, who will be excited about creative problem-solving as part of a cross-functional team with customer focus and will strive for the best end-user experience in addition to having the drive and desire to keep learning the latest architecture developments, standards and techniques.

The primary focus of this position is to provide technology and architectural leadership with respect to the design and delivery of highly-scalable customer data and insights solutions leveraging machine learning (ML) and artificial intelligence (AI) platforms.

This work will support development and delivery of information-intensive initiatives based on common practices for multiple complex projects.


What will you do?

  • Collaborate with business leaders to determine how to best apply technology to enable growth and success (e.g. scalable domain-driven solutions, operational reporting, SRE practices)
  • Provide architectural strategic thinking, information solutions, and input into roadmaps to drive delivery
  • Ensure architectural compliance of solutions and introduce recommendations for changes to reference model(s) when needed.
  • Maintain a plan to address gaps between current and target state architectures
  • Participate in \'reuse, buy and build\' decisions.
  • Understand potential impacts of proposed solutions on other systems, processes and/or projects
  • Articulate and document designs, considering trade-offs, costs, and benefits
  • Develop ongoing knowledge of current and emerging technologies
  • Identify new and emerging solutions, assess relevance and potential value to the organization, and present findings to teammates and management.
  • Participate in day-to-day execution of the architecture strategy
  • Develop blueprints and conduct design reviews to ensure architectural compliance of solutions.
  • Work across multiple projects and systems to develop, communicate, and mentor others on solution design, implementation and operation patterns and best practices

What do you need to succeed?

Must have:

  • Background in data architecture, analytics, and cloud native solutions
  • Experience with analysis techniques and measurement tools to continuously build valuable insights and business recommendations.
  • Strategic mindset with strong change management, continuous improvement and transformation skills
  • Strong technical skills in application development (data pipelines, services, streaming platforms)
  • Knowledge of identity and data access management and security best practices
  • Working knowledge in data acquisition, data storage & computational patterns with industry standard tools
  • Experience supporting mission-critical applications in production
  • Software engineering skills with distributed computing background and proven experience in delivering large-scale data platforms.
  • Good understanding of data fabric/mesh concepts and semantic layers

Nice to have:

  • Business or product leadership experience
  • Hands-on working experience with cloud native solution such as SnowFlake, DataBricks, Azure Data Factory, AWS Glue/Lamba, RedShift, Azure DW.
  • Experience with next generation solution delivery on technologies such as Python, Kafka, Spark, Apigee, Jenkins; container solutions including Docker/Kubernetes; and private cloud platforms such as Openshift (OCP) or Pivotal (PCF)
  • Exposure to building and deploying predictive and prescriptive analytics models using any of the following: Python SciKit, R and Pytorch.
  • Experience with Salesforce (CRM), Salesforce Marketing Cloud (SFMC) and/or Palintir Foundry

What’s in it for you? 

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

  • A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits, competitive compensation, commissions, and stock where applicable

  • Member of the front-end chapter, which provides training, events, and other opportunities for learning. You will also have an opportunity to share your work and experience with your peers

  • Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities

  • Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team

  • A world-class training program in financial services

  • Flexible work/life balance options​

RBC requires as a condition of employment that all successful candidates in the United States and Canada be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 prior to their start date, and may require proof of the same. Reasonable accommodation is available where required by law.

item.title: Manager, Process Improvement & Data Analytics
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Manager, Process Improvement & Data Analytics

Job Description

 What will you do?

  • Key member of the Data3Sixty Analyze logic building and maintenance team within Finance & Controller group
  • Analyze processes, gather requirements and look for solutions to improve
  • Build the automations and see them through the cycles of UAT, implementation in production, warranty period support and hand over to business as usual
  • Assist on various technology and automation projects within the group
  • Main contact for quick hits as technology expert in F&C group
  • Perform Derivatives GL booking difference analysis and intergroup trade matching in order to rectify any discrepancies
  • Work through ad hoc requests at peak times based on quarterly reporting needs

What do you need to succeed?

Must have

  • Undergraduate degree in Accounting/Finance or IT/ Data Science with 2-4 years minimum work experience
  • 2+ years technical experience working with various automation tools and large data sets. Ability to implementing large to medium size projects.
  • Strong analytical, problem solving and logical thinking skills
  • Technical competencies including sound knowledge of standard PC software (Strong knowledge of Microsoft applications: Access, Excel, Word and PowerPoint)
  • Experience programming
  • Good organizational, coordination, written and interpersonal skills

Nice-to-have

  • Post graduate degree such as MBA or IT/Finance related designation
  • Some knowledge and experience with Finance systems
  • Data3Sixty Analyze experience
  • MS Excel VBA experience

Job Summary

Working with Director Finance & Controller Process Excellence you will be looking at automations and process improvement opportunities within Finance & Controller group. The role will involve working with the business to understand process in order to drive continuous improvement, automation and innovation mainly related to large data sets and through the use of various tools at disposal such as Data3Sixty Analyze, Cognos Disclosure Manager, Excel, VBA, Tableau and any new tools identified with potential use cases. In this role you will also assist in some business as usual work, mainly related to intergroup derivative reconciliation processes, remediation of breaks and matching of large data sets.

item.title: Associate, Investment Analytics
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Associate, Investment Analytics

Job Description

What is the Opportunity? 

RBC Wealth Management is one of the world’s top 10 largest wealth managers. RBC Wealth Management directly serves affluent, high-net-worth (HNW) and ultra-high net worth (UHNW) clients in Canada, the United States and select international markets with a full suite of banking, investment, trust and other wealth management solutions. The business also provides asset management products and services directly and through RBC and third party distributors to institutional and individual clients, through its RBC Global Asset Management business (which includes BlueBay Asset Management).


Are you looking to help move forward the advanced analytics capabilities of an investment group from early stages to beyond? Our team is responsible for developing and maintaining performance, risk and advanced analytics reporting for RBC Wealth Management Investment & Trading group (I&T) in Canada. If you are detail-oriented, eager to learn, ready to apply both investment and technical knowledge skills, this Associate position in our Investment Management Analytics team might be the right opportunity for you.  Help us deliver the best portfolio and market insights, in addition to the tools to support the needs of our portfolio managers and strategists.  
 

What will you do? 

  • Learn the business as usual for performance and risk management to support our investment committees.

  • Help improve processes as we integrate new datasets to automate business as usual where possible.

  • Support the development of our data pipelines and methods to deliver insights (web, tableau, excel, etc) to our various equity and multi-asset portfolio specialists. 

  • Support I&T’s ability to capitalize on opportunities to increase the efficiency and effectiveness of RBC Wealth Management’s investment strategy by partnering with the Investments & Trading team and various groups across RBC focused on improving our analytics processes and capabilities.

  • Ensure accuracy and quality through production of summaries and reports while meeting timelines on recurring reporting needs.

  • Ensure policies and procedures are implemented and documented.

  • Conduct Ad hoc projects, data extractions or analysis as directed.

  • Be a part of a start-up like setting where fast-fail is highly valued, level of uncertainty is high and requirements are not all defined in advance (iterative feedback loop).   

 
What do you need to succeed?
Must Have:

  • Bachelor’s Degree in Commerce, Finance, Economics, Computer Science or related quantitative discipline (e.g., Engineering, Physics, Mathematics, Statistics)

  • Experience/interest in performance and risk reporting and analysis.

  • Pursuing/interest in Chartered Financial Analyst or other finance/risk training or designation

  • Knowledge of SQL and at least one programming language (Python, R, Matlab, C, C#, Java, etc).

  • Excellent teamwork and collaboration skills. Good communication with peers and end users, to understand and translate the business requirements into data-related recommendations and solutions.

  • Knowledge of financial systems (FactSet, Bloomberg, Refinitiv, etc) and working with time series data from these vendors.

  • Drive to ensure data quality throughout all stages of acquisition and processing, including data sourcing/collection, normalization, and transformation.

  • Great attention to detail.


Nice to Have

  • Experience using Git, Github, Zenhub. Experience in agile design methodologies and frameworks.

  • Experience working with Tableau.

  • Experience using cloud-enabled technologies such as Amazon Web Services (AWS), specifically S3, Athena, EMR, RDS, or other AWS database related products.

  • Experience with big data analytics technologies (e.g. Hadoop, Spark, Kafka); experience compiling, manipulating and analyzing large datasets, with a good understanding of data processing frameworks.

What’s in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

  • Opportunities to do challenging work, and to gain wide breadth of exposure in the Operational Risk space, including Supplier/Third Party risk, Legal and Regulatory risk, IT risk, as well as other aspects of product, financial, project and Fraud risk.

  • Gain a breadth of experience and exposure to the global WM platform

  • Opportunities to take on progressively greater accountabilities 

  • Opportunities to building close relationships with clients

item.title: Manager, CRM Analytics
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Manager, CRM Analytics

Job Description

What is the opportunity?

RBC is hiring an exciting Manager, CRM Analytics role. In this role, you will work closely with members of the CRM Analytics team and collaborate with various partners including the Lines of Business across Personal and Commercial Banking providing actionable insights and developing solutions that enhance the client experience and drive value for the business.

What will you do?

  • Deliver insightful and actionable analytics to underpin the Client Growth initiative enabling client acquisition and retention across all lines of business
  • End-to-end responsibility for campaign analyses including framing of analytical objectives with partners, sourcing relevant data, performing in-depth analyses and presenting key insights to stakeholders in timely and effective manner
  • Examine and evaluate all facets of the marketing leads conversion process in order to produce key findings and recommendations that augment offer fulfillments
  • Analyze utilization of valuable outbound resources to optimize marketing opportunities for individual campaigns
  • Conduct marketing contact channel analyses to provide pertinent information and proposals supporting Client Interaction Strategy to enhance client experience and drive business values
  • Develop dashboards and monitor performance of various marketing channels to ensure client interactions are uniquely managed in the constantly evolving environment
  • Provide analytical support in other associated client and marketing initiatives

What do you need to succeed?

Must-have:

  • Proficient technical knowledge with very large relational databases and with tools such as SQL and SAS
  • Sound business acumen and strong analytical, communication and presentation skills
  • Strong problem solving skill and ability to conceptualize strategy
  • Demonstrated ability to work well collaboratively in a cross function environment as well as independently with initiative taking ownership

Nice-to-have:

  • Master’s degree in quantitative discipline
  • Experience in financial services industry with broad understanding of marketing, product management, sales, finance, pricing and risk management
  • Experience with Hadoop and Google Analytics

What’s in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

  • An opportunity to influence the strategic direction of the enterprise
  • An opportunity to work closely with RBC’s senior leaders
  • Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive and high performing culture
  • Excellent career development and progression opportunities
  • A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses, eligibility for stock and flexible benefits

item.title: Manager, Reporting & Analytics
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Manager, Reporting & Analytics

Job Description

  • The Manager, Reporting & Analytics will work within Operations to develop, design, implement and manage executive reporting that supports Data Centre Infrastructure & Strategy (DCIS) strategic priorities. In addition, the incumbent will also guide and shape strategic choices of the Senior Management team by building out the reporting and analytic ecosystem, delivering ad-hoc analytics and be a subject matter data expert.
  • Drive business results by the design, development and production of insightful Executive reporting that aligns with, and supports DCIS strategic priorities.
  • Leverage financial acumen to synthesize and distil key information to enable faster Senior Management decision making and assists in the establishment of action plans to maximize business performance.
  • Provide expert support and analyses around Apptio deep dive requests resulting from stakeholder enquiries. Sourcing relevant data, performing in-depth analysis and presenting actionable insights to stakeholders in a timely and effective manner.
  • Deliver complete, accurate and timely reporting of contracts, financials and audit & risk activities to enable the business to meet their short and long term goals.
  • Interact with senior leadership to understand their objectives in order to continue to evolve and maximize effectiveness and align reporting and analytics to meet those objectives.
  • Investigate industry trends and organization knowledge to provide alternative reporting approaches/solutions (ex. dashboards, graphical visualizations) that will drive performance to improve insights and analytics across Operations
  • Review and leverage internal and external data/information to provide insights and context around impactful/actionable/controllable business performance opportunities through the use of key performance indicators

RBC requires as a condition of employment that all successful candidates in the United States and Canada be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 prior to their start date, and may require proof of the same. Reasonable accommodation is available where required by law.

item.title: Manager, Fraud Research and Analytics
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Manager, Fraud Research and Analytics

Job Description

What is the opportunity?

Fraud Management (FM) teams employ deep subject matter expertise in identifying, assessing, mitigating and controlling fraud risks for the Enterprise.  Within Fraud Management, the Fraud Data Science & Analytics (FDSA) team develops and optimizes fraud detection strategies to maximize operational effectiveness and minimize client impact. The FDSA Research and Analytics function  conducts analytic research into fraud issues identifying  causation and correlation, develop insights on emerging trends, gaps or systemic issues, and collaborate with Fraud Management partners to communicate results and take action.

Please Note: While the work arrangement for this opportunity is primarily remote, you may be required to periodically attend an approved RBC office location.

What will you do?

  • Identify patterns, trends and hidden causation and correlation relationships from Fraud data and advise FM SMT of emerging trends, specific gaps or systemic issues that impact the Fraud Risk of RBC
  • Collaborate with appropriate partners for action, correction, awareness and training
  • Forecast Financials and Fraud KPI’s using predictive analytics techniques and generate insights for executive decision making and communicating results through insightful visualizations, white papers, reports and presentations
  • Research business problems, develop solutions to support investigation and analysis and lead progression of analytics methodology, tools and measurement to create development templates for automation
  • Build the foundation of information in consolidated data repositories for Operations, Fraud Events, Fraud Performance and Financials
  • Provide a complete picture of the fraud landscape with drill-down capabilities for root cause analysis and deliver self-serve interactive visualizations through accessible platforms like Tableau
  • Conduct Code Reviews and develop standards for Development practices and partner with project teams to support information required for analysis of the current state
  • Deliver Project Reporting for Fraud Events, Performance, Operational and Financial KPI’s and KRI’s and Program Benefits measurements to track success criteria of the Project Business Case

What do you need to succeed?

  • 2+ years’ experience in a Data science and analytics
  • Advanced capability in using Python, R, PySpark, SAS, SQL and Tableau
  • Experience with Databases and Data Structures (RDBMS, Hadoop etc.)
  • Ability to apply data and analytics concepts to business problems and explain business value of data and analytics concepts
  • Ability to multi-task and prioritize and complete projects effectively and in a timely manner
  • Strong team player with a track record of collaboration and experience working as part of an agile team
  • Professional verbal and written communication and presentation skills, and ability to provide consultation, analysis, and recommendations on a broad range of projects in a deadline driven environment with ambiguity
  • Good understanding of Canadian Financial Institutions, with a focus on Fraud/Risk Operations

Nice-to-have

  • Degree in mathematics, statistics, economics, computer science, software engineering or related quantitative field

What’s in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

  • Fair compensation
  • Challenging work in a fast-paced timeline driven work environment
  • Ability to make a difference and lasting impact 
  • Work with a great and supportive team

RBC is committed to supporting flexible work arrangements when and where available. Details to be discussed with Hiring Manager.

RBC requires as a condition of employment that all successful candidates in the United States and Canada be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 prior to their start date, and may require proof of the same. Reasonable accommodation is available where required by law.

item.title: Senior Manager, Data Insight Analytics
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Senior Manager, Data Insight Analytics

Job Description

What is the opportunity?

As a Senior Manager, Data Insight Analytics, you will work closely with Digital Platform Product Owners, LOB Product Owners, Marketing and Sales teams, and Senior Management to structure analyses, uncover analytic insights, develop net new data assets, build dashboards and model data that will enable data-driven decisions.

In this role you will be responsible for supporting the end-to-end implementation of the analytics lifecycle - data collection, deep dive insight analytics, reporting and presentations.

You will provide objective, value-added insights and analysis to enable product owners to make strategic data-driven decisions. The person in this role will build critical understanding of RBCs products and the associated client behaviours to help deliver business value. The delivery of business value in this role comes from a combination of knowledge transfer to key stakeholders and the provisioning of data services and tests to client facing applications. 

What will you do?

  • Insights and Analytics:

    • Execute analytics plans on large data sets representing the behaviors, demographics and product attribute of prospects and clients. 

    • Use a variety of analytical methods (descriptive, diagnostic and predictive) such as causal inference, time series analysis, and hypothesis testing to find actionable insights

    • Develop and test hypotheses on data and data models

    • Based on evidence, make recommendations to leadership and stakeholders to support strategies and drive decisions

  • Data Collection/Ingestions/Acquisition:

    • Collaborate with data developers, DevOps, data engineers and cloud engineers to implement new data collection/ingestion/acquisition

    • Support business stakeholders in identifying needs for additional data acquisitions, and coordinate plans to orchestrate data acquisitions

    • Find, clean and structure data

    • Develop templates and systems for repeatable processes

  • Digital Product Reporting and Presentations:

    • Support the creation of Business Intelligence reporting that can be automated using reporting tools

    • Define, communicate and enforce reporting and analytics standards, policies and data governance

    • Help construct presentations in story format

    • Deliver clear, concise and timely reports and presentations identifying trends, issues and opportunities 

  • Stakeholder Consultancy:

    • Support relationships with key business stakeholders to develop, execute and monitor complex insights and analytical solutions to business problems using a variety of analytical approaches and methodologies.

    • Digest complex problems and organize into achievable milestones. Manages stakeholder expectations and keeps them up-to-date with project statuses.

    • Apply expertise and think creatively to address unique or ambiguous situations and to find solutions to problems that can be complex and non-routine 

What do you need to succeed? 

Must-have

  • 5+ years\' experience in related digital product development, marketing analyst or data mining role

  • Proven analytics and problem solving skills

  • Strong drive and desire to understand relationship of organizational components

  • BA/BSc or above in mathematics, economics, statistics, computer science or related quantitative field

  • Advanced experience with SQL, Python, or Scala

  • Knowledge of advanced digital analytics methodologies such as experimentation and testing, competitive analysis, surveys and market research.

  • Strong team player with track record of collaboration and experience working as part of an agile team

Nice-to-have

  • Experience with Spark, Scala, Hive, Python is a preferred

  • Good understanding of AWS Big Data services such as Amazon S3, EMR and Glue

  • Experienced with Jupyter Notebooks, IntelliJ, Visual Studio Code other notebook environments

  • Experience working in Unix/Linux environments

  • Experience working as part of an agile team using Github and JIRA

  • Experience with digital data collection tools such as Google Analytics

  • Knowledgeable in data modeling, data orchestration and data pipeline 

What’s in it for you?

  • We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

  • A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits, competitive compensation, commissions, and stock where applicable

  • Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities

  • Ability to make a difference and lasting impact

  • Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team

  • A world-class training program in financial services

  • Flexible work/life balance options

  • Opportunities to do challenging work

  • Opportunities to take on progressively greater accountabilities         

  • Opportunities to building close relationships with clients

  • Access to a variety of job opportunities across business and geographies

RBC requires as a condition of employment that all successful candidates in the United States and Canada be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 prior to their start date, and may require proof of the same. Reasonable accommodation is available where required by law.

Il est possible qu\'ils aient à présenter une preuve vaccinale. Des mesures raisonnables d\'adaptation sont offertes lorsque la loi l\'exige

item.title: Associate Director, Market Risk Analytics
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Associate Director, Market Risk Analytics

Job Description

What is the opportunity?

Group Risk Management (GRM) provides independent and effective on-site monitoring, controlling, and reporting on the nature and extent of all material market risk on the RBC London Trading Floor – ensuring implementation of and compliance with risk management policies and procedures.

We are looking for someone to manage the development and strategic rollout of the reporting infrastructure for Structured Rates and Global Equities businesses. The incumbent will have strong problem solving, analytical and communication skills – and a track-record of delivering infrastructure changes by devising solutions and liaising with key stakeholders towards project completion.

You will have previous coding experience in Python, VBA, and SQL. You will be able to write tactical scripts where needed, whilst working with key stakeholders to drive strategic change. Hands on experience with Tableau (or similar) is required and  should ideally have a basic understanding of financial products and the main risk factors within the interest rate and equity businesses.  

What will you do?

  • Develop indepth knowledge of the current and strategic reporting infrastructure state
  • Propose, build, and develop tactical and strategic enhancements to the reporting infrastructure
  • Repurpose and rebuild the existing VBA-based reports to the strategic model/infrastructure
  • Enhance Tableau-based reports, and optimise existing reports
  • Co-ordinate project plans, and work with key IT and Risk Management stakeholders to drive deliverables to completion
  • Automate various daily tasks involved in the current reporting infrastructure, including implementation of control frameworks and best-practise checks
  • Provide support to the Risk Managers on day to day running of risk reports
  • Regularly update and clearly communicate progress and milestones with GRM management/users

What do you need to succeed?

 Must-have

  • Strong leadership skills and vision ; proven record of leading a team/project and delivering value-added results
  • Hands on experience working on large datasets and databases
  • Ability to understand and clearly communicated around highly complicated reporting infrastructure dependencies related to books of complex derivatives portfolios
  • Proficient in VBA/Python/SQL
  • Hands-on experience of Tableau
  • Excellent written and oral communication skills ; is able to articulate ideas, thought processes, and recommendations confidently and rationally to senior audiences
  • Relevant experience working with Group Risk Management/Trading at a top-tier financial company
  • Good understanding of the day-to-day responsibilities of Market Risk, and daily risk reporting
  • Preferable knowledge of derivatives and greeks for interest rate and equity option products, Stress testing and scenario analysis and value-at-Risk measurement

What is in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best - progressive thinking to keep growing and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper.  We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

  • A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses, flexible benefits and competitive compensation
  • Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities
  • Opportunities to work with the best in the field
  • Ability to make a difference and lasting impact
  • Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team
  • A world-class training program in financial services
  • Flexible working options fully supported.

Job Summary

Group Risk Management (GRM) provides independent and effective on-site monitoring, controlling, and reporting on the nature and extent of all material market risk on the RBC London Trading Floor – ensuring implementation of and compliance with risk management policies and procedures.

We are looking for someone to manage the development and strategic rollout of the reporting infrastructure for Structured Rates and Global Equities businessses. The incumbent will have strong problem solving, analytical and communication skills – and a track-record of delivering infrastructure changes by devising solutions and liaising with key stakeholders towards project completion.

The person will have previous coding experience in Python, VBA, and SQL. The person should be able to write tactical scripts where needed, whilst working with key stakeholders to drive strategic change. Hands on experience with Tableau (or similar) is required. The person should ideally have a basic understanding of financial products and the main risk factors within the interest rate and equity businesses.

item.title: Senior Manager Pricing and Analytics
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Senior Manager Pricing and Analytics

Job Description

Pricing

  • Develop pricing strategies backed by data driven insights and competitor analyses.
  • Implement end-to-end pricing strategies that include pricing proposals / memos, sales partner engagements, IT requirements and QA/PIV.
  • Work closely with PM&CS and Finance partners to ensure pricing assumptions are regularly reviewed, and challenged when necessary, in order for RBC to remain competitive.
  • Proactively engage in post implementation verification of all pricing changes.
  • Recommend pricing changes directly to Director, Senior Director, and VP in AF N.O.

Analytics

  • Own and perform regular analysis of pricing strategy impacts to ensure they are in line with profitability objectives.
  • Perform frequent market deep-dives and provide competitor insights in order for RBC to remain competitive.  This includes using RBC and third party data to identify deterioration in KPI’s (market share, look share and efficiencies).  Analyse results and provide recommendations to the Director of Pricing & Analytics.
  • Perform deep-dives into the auto finance portfolio to identify early trends and behaviours of both customers and dealers.
  • Proactively seek out and identify potential reporting gaps, new sources of data and recommend solutions.

Monitoring  & Tool Development

  • Develop monitoring tools that measure the success of pricing strategies that will also serve as an ‘always on’ PIV.
  • Enhance new origination and portfolio reporting through the use of leading edge analytics, methods and tools for the early detection of opportunities, trends and anomalies.  Continuously research and develop new methodologies and tools to enhance reporting.
  • Develop and improve tools/models used to monitor the auto finance portfolio

RBC is committed to supporting flexible work arrangements when and where available. Details to be discussed with Hiring Manager.
RBC requires as a condition of employment that all successful candidates in the United States and Canada be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 prior to their start date, and may require proof of the same. Reasonable accommodation is available where required by law.

Job Summary

A Senior Manager of Pricing and Analytics is responsible for the development and end-to-end implementation of pricing strategies that directly impacts RBC’s market share, portfolio balance and P&L. Actionable insights and recommendations provided to senior leadership with a focus on profitability, competitive landscape and risk. The Senior Manager participates in preparing senior leadership presentations and discussions, enabling the business to make informed decisions regarding the profitability and risk profile of the portfolio. The employee is expected to have strong business acumen, communication and analytical skills and assists in construction and monitoring of the retail portfolio.

item.title: Senior Manager, Project Risk Analytics
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Senior Manager, Project Risk Analytics

Job Description

  • Responsible for the accurate and timely reporting of the enterprise project risk profiles, analysis and exposures to the Executives and Senior Management on a regular basis.  Reporting should include existing and emerging areas of risk, implications for Operational Risk appetite, and the ability of the risk management and control infrastructure to support business activities
  • Providing senior leadership and regulators qualitative and quantitative statements to convey real and potential Project Risk
  • Reporting of our Key Risk Indicators (KRI) for Project Risk: Future State Risk, Delivery Risk, and Investment Risk
  • Supports the completion of OSFI Self Assessments, designs and tests ERIC Controls for OE & DE annually; contributes to Regulatory (OSFI and other) Advisory Letter responses
  • Timely delivery of ad hoc regulatory data and reporting requests
  • Development of a Key Performance Indicator (KPI) Dashboard on the status of our PMO landscape
  • Support and execute annual Project Risk Assessment activities
  • Contribute to the establishment of, and provide ongoing support, to the CAO Project Management Office

Must-haves:

  • Solid understanding of BI tools and Tableau
  • Strong Risk Management capabilities (in another Risk Domain), preferably 2nd line of defense
  • Ability to analyze and interpret data in order to draw insights of real or potential risk
  • Experience communicating with senior and executive leadership
  • Experience managing multiple threads of work, moving at different paces
  • Expertise in creating and deploying best practices and methodologies
  • Working knowledge in the creation and maintenance of Connect and SharePoint sites

Nice-to-haves:

  • Experience with Agile project management principles, including use of Kanban boards for work management
  • Proven Project Delivery practices, with working knowledge of Planview enterprise portfolio management tool
  • Experience using Kanban boards for work management (Planview LeanKit preferred)
  • Strategic mindset, with excellent knowledge and understanding of RBC businesses and organization
  • Ability to influence outcomes in a matrixed environment

Job Summary

We’re looking for someone to join the Project Risk Governance team; this person is passionate about risk governance and is an expert in data analysis, interpretation and reporting. Sound like you? If so, review the description below and tell us why you’re the winning candidate!

The Senior Manager, Project Risk Reporting and Analytics is responsible for key risk reporting and analysis activities within the Enterprise Project Risk Centre of Governance (PR CoG). Collaborating with PMO partners, application owners, the Senior Manager, Project Risk Reporting and Analytics provides insight through reporting and analytics on the Project Risk posture of the Enterprise. They contribute to senior executive enterprise risk reporting on project risk policy, compliance testing, as well as supporting the CAO Project Management Office.

item.title: Sr Manager, Rewards Insights & Analytics
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Sr Manager, Rewards Insights & Analytics

Job Description

What is the opportunity?

You will play a pivotal role in managing the day to day RBC Rewards loyalty program, collaborating with key business partners in developing and executing the loyalty strategy and ongoing monitoring of RBC Rewards financial, business and competitive performance. You will be responsible for leading and supporting the consolidation of the monthly and quarterly business results which are reviewed with Senior Management team driving discussions to make informed decisions and achieve business goals. This candidate will partner with the various LOBs, COEs, innovation teams and partners to deliver actionable insights to management and key stakeholders.

What will you do?

  • Lead business planning/forecasting, budgeting, monthly and quarterly business reviews with Loyalty leadership team
  • Lead and support the business case development to deliver client value and engagement  of new value propositions, LOB expansion and with various loyalty program constructs
  • Support the quarterly review of Rewards Liability analysis and assumptions review
  • Collaborate with Finance partner to manage loyalty liability, CPP (cost per point), breakage and other key financial metrics
  • Leverage complex data and provide analytics and strategic insights to make informed decisions, including the identification of business improvement opportunities
  • Manage the overall cost efficiency program with Loyalty SMT
  • Competitive benchmarking of performance and strategies against traditional and non-traditional global players
  • Partner with analytics COEs and Rewards business teams in campaign design, measurement & insights to optimize the marketing ROI
  • Lead the analysis of client behaviour, market trends, competitive landscape to deliver data-driven insights identifying business opportunities and risks for RBC Rewards
  • Support data work streams related to Loyalty Transformation program
  • Engage in loyalty initiatives/ projects to drive strategic decisions and changes, including data analysis, modeling, and deep-diving for insights to help make informed decisions
  • Effectively manage and prioritize multiple business initiatives, projects, ah-hoc analysis requests with business stakeholders and/or partners

What do you need to succeed?

Must-have

  • Strong business acumen, collaboration and communication/presentation/reporting writing skills
  • Strong analytical skills with the ability to interpret complex data and make data-based strategic decisions, while looking for opportunities to innovate.
  • Strong critical thinking and creative problem-solving skills
  • Proficiency with data manipulation and analytical tools
  • Solid understanding of data management practices and data pipelines
  • Understanding of trend analytics and forecasting business results
  • Demonstrated collaborative ability to partner with and direct a number of internal partners
  • Attention to detail, organization, ability to multi task and time management is critical
  • Experience with Tableau

Nice-to-have

  • Payments / Credit Card / Loyalty business expertise
  • Experience in building financial models
  • Bachelor degree in a quantitative field such as Statistics, Finance. 
  • Knowledge of internal RBC data applications and procedures

What’s in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

  • A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits, competitive compensation

You will be responsible for leading and supporting the consolidation of the monthly and quarterly business results which are reviewed with Senior Management team driving discussions to make informed decisions and achieve business goals. This candidate will partner with the various LOBs, COEs, innovation teams and partners to deliver actionable insights to management and key stakeholders.

item.title: Lead Developer Data Protection and Analytics
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Lead Developer Data Protection and Analytics

Job Description

What is the opportunity?

The data protection team is at the forefront of delivering actionable insider threat and analytics services. Using data science practices tied to web and analytics services it helps highlight actionable events for ongoing investigations.

As the lead developer, you will be accountable for extending and enhancing current application services while working closely with product owners to develop and link together various components with a focus on overall fidelity of data models, optimization, product design and delivering enhancements as part of current managed web analytics services. This opportunity is suitable for someone who is skilled in web application development, motivated, someone who enjoy working on a variety of problems and enhancements, someone who works well in a multi-disciplinary team as well as working independently on key tasks.

If you want to innovate and be part of a big picture strategic delivery with a direct impact on organization change this is the placement for you!

What will you do?

  • Delivering new design and development specifications based on customer requirements, while adhering to standard procedures and techniques.
  • Creating test transactions and running tests to find errors and revise application programs.
  • Participating in post-implementation reviews of application development content and processes; continually working to create a learning environment by sharing about the participation process with others.
  • Supporting the implementation of application programs; fixing any existing or new bugs.
  • Design, Develop and enhance current web services
  • Help design, implementing and optimized UI functions
  • Collaborate within the team and stakeholders to enhance and expand current solutions

What do you need to succeed?
Must-have

  • BS/MS in Computer Science or related area or equivalent experience
  • 3-5 years of professional full stack development
  • 3+ years with experience of working with Python/Java/HTML/CSS/SQL
  • Ability to understand software requirements based on program specification
  • Demonstrated experience with building web application frameworks like flask
  • Strong knowledge of web design, testing phases and working with data science
  • Understanding of software development lifecycle and experience with API
  • Experience of development in Cloud environment
  • Excellent analytical skills and problem solving attitude
  • Experience with relational databases(MSSQL, MySQL)

Nice to have

  • Experience with machine learning and statistical techniques, testing/validation, visualizing data, test results and assess model performance
  • Experience with analytics, anomaly detection, model refinement and efficacy
  • Experience with big data technologies – Hadoop, NoSQL/SQL databases, parallel processing techniques, and graph technologies
  • Experience in building backend system with Python, Flask
  • Experience with CI/CD pipelines
  • Knowledge of DevOps and strong debugging skills
  • Experience with Git and process automation
  • Experience in UI/UX Design

item.title: Senior Manager, Everyday Banking and Payments Analytics
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Senior Manager, Everyday Banking and Payments Analytics

Job Description

What will you do?

  • Leverage complex data to provide analytics and strategic insights for business decisions and to explore new opportunities for Banking and Payments, including  
    • Detailed understanding of the product and segment analytics and financials
    • Business insight into acquisition and retention activities, channel performance and market share
    • Information in support of business optimization and business cases
    • Deep dives on new product innovation
    • Special projects as assigned
  • Work collaboratively with the Banking and Payments leadership team, and other analytics teams across the organization to enhance business decision-making through use of reporting, advanced analytics and combining multiple sources of data to measure key indicators of performance and early detection of opportunities, trends & anomalies.
  • Monitor and evaluate strategy effectiveness through the implementation of various tests (e.g. foundational testing, price optimization tests) and analysis on previous in-market tests and strategies.
  • Create materials to communicate the insights developed either through new monthly / quarterly reporting or specific stakeholder presentations and working sessions.
  • Work effectively with key stakeholders throughout the analytics and insights process to deliver high quality results aligned to the needs of the business.
  • Provide concise, timely and insightful reporting to senior management on relevant matters relating to Banking and Payments portfolio.

What do you need to succeed?

Must have:

  • Strong analytical skills with the ability to interpret complex data and make data-based strategic decisions, while looking for opportunities to innovate.
  • Proficiency with data manipulation and analytical tools including Excel, SQL, SAS, Tableau, Python.
  • Proven ability to collaborate with a diverse set of stakeholders in defining and solving business problems.
  • Ability to be effective and equally conversant in business and technical environment.
  • University degree in a quantitative field of study (e.g., statistics, economics, business, engineering) to demonstrate ability for critical thinking & numerical analytics.
  • 5+ years related work experience in analytics, product or quantitative strategy roles.

Nice to have:

  • Experience in building financial models /valuations
  • Experience with statistical tools, test design, and predictive analytics

What’s in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

  • Ability to make a difference and lasting impact
  • Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team
  • Opportunities to do challenging work

Job Summary

Our Vision is to be Canadians’ leading choice for all payment and everyday banking activities, extending our market leading position through superior value, innovation, and differentiated experiences that drive acquisition and engagement.
In this role, you will be using data and analytics to improve our understanding of client behaviours, as well as improve in-market strategies and inform the design of our suite of products.
You will be working collaboratively with the broader Banking and Payments team, and use advanced analytical tools and multiple data sources (e.g. client segment data, bureau data, client behaviour data across all RBC products, online and mobile interaction data) in order to formulate strategies that optimize the business, enhance product construct, and provide value to our customers. Finally, you will be responsible for designing dashboards to support business reviews with Executives and complete deep dives to explain key trends and identify strategic opportunities.

item.description:

Job Title

Manager, Business Intelligence

Job Description

What is the opportunity?

In this role you will support Caribbean Banking initiatives through analytic leadership and provision of regular and ad hoc reporting and analytics.  You will be responsible for advancing and improving data process automation capabilities and the end to end delivery of comprehensive reporting and data solutions which help optimize business results and inform fact-based decisions.

What will you do?

  • Lead the design, development, documentation and delivery of an array of reporting and analytical solutions, metrics and insights for various leadership teams in Caribbean Banking
  • Participate in business requirement and/or data gathering sessions with colleagues and internal partners to understand business opportunities and problems in the context of reporting requirements and recommend solutions
  • Support continuous improvement activities through use of available data sources and tools to enhance effectiveness and ensure reporting and analytics solutions continue to be seen as “value add” to respective stakeholders
  • Identify opportunities for efficiency and effectiveness and make appropriate recommendations pertaining to process streamlining and/or leveraging technology to enable automation, mitigate risk of error, and improve user experience
  • Act as SME both within the team and cross-functionally, on key performance measurements and provide insight through comprehensive analysis
  • Perform investigations, ad-hoc requests, data analysis and support reporting escalations
  • Promote and share best practices with teammates and stakeholders

Must-have

  • Undergraduate degree in Computer Science, Mathematics/Statistics, related quantitative field, or equivalent related experience

item.title: Senior Product Manager Business Deposits & Analytics
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Senior Product Manager Business Deposits & Analytics

Job Description

What is the opportunity?

RBC is currently looking for a Senior Product Manager reporting into the Business Liquidity & Deposit Solutions team.  You will be a Product Management leader accountable for the delivery and management of applicable deposits products and as well as related enhancements, targeting Business Clients across all channels and market segmentations.  You will lead key strategic initiatives for Business Deposits including interest rate pricing along with risk and growth strategies for the entire portfolio.  You will apply extensive, in-depth knowledge, skills, and practices to perform complex assignments, and will focus on the analytics and portfolio insights for business deposits and liquidity solutions supporting the needs of the business. You will apply data & analytics expertise along with strong business acumen to surface relevant insights and recommend actions.

From tracking market rate movements, engaging treasury and the field on how business deposits are behaving, and supporting pricing and analytics to broader flow of funds across the portfolio- this is an exciting role very much entrenched into one of the largest revenue contributors to Business Financial Services. The role will require utilizing data & analytics expertise to surface insights along with a good balance of storytelling, and cross-collaboration with stakeholders to drive market share volume growth along with net interest income growth.

What will you do?

  • Evaluating processes and resources to identify potential limitations in product. Modifying designs to maximize client adoption and product quality.
  • Gathering internal and external feedback to identify potential new products or improvements to existing products.
  • Developing and using tools for ongoing management of existing products and also make recommendations for new products or revisions to existing products. Tracking the status of projects from inception to release.
  • Generating processes and plans to measure product quality and evaluating results to identify deficiencies. Adjusting to client’s and business needs and requirements as needed.
  • Leverage data and analytics to generate strategic insights for the business including market share performance, portfolio monitoring metrics and profitability
  • Act as a partner and subject matter expert to the team on RBC internal data
  • Deliver accurate and timely analytics that enable the business to meet both short term and long term Market Share objectives
  • Deliver end-to-end analysis and present actionable insights to stakeholders in a timely and effective manner
  • Communicate, frame and align analytical objectives with senior leaders
  • Own, automate, and standardize deposits portfolio analyses and work collaboratively with partners such as Corporate Treasury, Finance, Sales etc...
  • Build and maintain complex queries, reports and dashboards for products & features that drive value in pricing decisions and customer conversations
  • Promote data science & analytics across the broader team to enable RBC to become a data-driven organization 

What do you need to succeed?

Must-have

  • University degree in Quantitative field of study (e.g Statistics, Economics, Finance, Engineering)  and/or MBA – Role requires broad business management insight and knowledge, especially in Business Sector Behaviour
  • 5-10 years in Data Science/Finance/Analytics field
  • Significant experience in utilizing advanced SQL to build meaningful data views
  • Expert programming skills with Python. Proficient with data manipulation and visualization libraries/frameworks
  • Expert visualization skills with Tableau
  • Effective and comfortable in business and technical environment.
  • Ability to take initiative, multi-task and work in a fast-paced environment
  • Strong Project Management skills
  • Influencing skills
  • Strong PowerPoint skills in creating and presenting

Nice-to-have

  • Experience in payment and cash management
  • Bank Liabilities/Deposits Management & Interest Rate Risk Knowledge
  • Product Management experience
  • Agile Methodology

What’s in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

  • A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits, competitive compensation
  • Ability to make a difference and lasting impact which includes exposure to key decision makers throughout the organization
  • Work with a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team
  • Opportunity to take on progressively responsibilities commensurate with your performance

RBC is committed to supporting flexible work arrangements when and where available. Details to be discussed with Hiring Manager.

RBC requires as a condition of employment that all successful candidates in the United States and Canada be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 prior to their start date, and may require proof of the same. Reasonable accommodation is available where required by law.

item.title: Associate Director, Enterprise Model Risk Management, GRM - 12 Month Contract
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Associate Director, Enterprise Model Risk Management, GRM - 12 Month Contract

Job Description

What is the opportunity? 

As Associate Director, you work in close proximity with model stakeholders in order to vet and validate mathematical models used by RBC, mainly focusing on models related to Enterprise Market Risk (EMR).  You vet, validate and/or replicate, as necessary, various models (pricing, risk, etc.) used for VaR/SVaR and RWA regulatory capital for businesses and products used by the bank.  As Associate Director, you are a trusted advisor and effective challenger to model developers and users on all matters pertaining to EMR modeling requirements.  You ensure EMRM has proper understanding and documentation of the models’ business purpose and context and will facilitate RBC compliance with regulatory policies, guidelines, and procedures on model risk.

What will you do? 

  • Engage model builders (Market Risk, Quantitative Risk Analytics, etc.) and related function groups personnel as necessary in order to proactively assess, document, and independently validate mathematical models and their usage by the bank
  • Perform effective challenge of model inputs, methodology, and implementation
  • Acquire and maintain a thorough understanding of the flow and context of model usage by the business
  • Ensure that model users adhere to RBC model risk policy

What do you need to succeed?

Must-have 

  • 3+ years of work experience in mathematical modeling, preferably at a large financial institution, in a similar or related role such as a model developer/validator, a front office quant, a risk quant, or a risk manager
  • Broad exposure to and excellent knowledge of derivatives pricing and risk models for main product types (FIC, IR/FX, equity, commodity, securitized products, credit), and quantitative risk management methodology
  • Exceptional analytical, computational and critical thinking skills
  • Good familiarity with financial regulatory requirements and guidelines, such as OSFI CAR and FRB CCAR
  • Graduate degree in a quantitative discipline such as physics, math, engineering, computer science, statistics, finance or financial engineering; Strong academic and research background may also count towards work experience
  • Strong verbal and written communication and interpersonal skills

What’s in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

  • Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities
  • Ability to make a difference and lasting impact
  • Work in an agile, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team
  • The opportunity to interface with senior level executives from many different parts of the organization

Job Summary

As Associate Director, you work in close proximity with model stakeholders in order to vet and validate mathematical models used by RBC, mainly focusing on models related to Enterprise Market Risk (EMR). You vet, validate and/or replicate, as necessary, various models (pricing, risk, etc.) used for VaR/SVaR and RWA regulatory capital for businesses and products used by the bank. As Associate Director, you are a trusted advisor and effective challenger to model developers and users on all matters pertaining to EMR modeling requirements. You ensure EMRM has proper understanding and documentation of the models’ business purpose and context and will facilitate RBC compliance with regulatory policies, guidelines, and procedures on model risk.

item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Senior Analyst, Risk & Control Governance Cad

Job Description

What is the opportunity?
You will execute the Canada Operations Risk & Control framework to ensure risks are proactively identified, measured, monitored, and escalated appropriately.
You will need to have excellent communicaiton skills (both verbal and written) to be able to articulate clearly, prepare reports and present clearly and professionally.
 
 
What will you do?

  • Administer the ‘Risk and Control Assessment Program’ (RCAP) based in Canada
  • Participate in the review, analysis and reporting  of the Operational Risk Events
  • Lead/Participate in Control Assessment/Testing, partner with the BCS teams to identify, assess and manage operational risks/control deficiencies
  • Monitor outstanding issues & actions (Operational Risk, Compliance and Audit) to ensure timely resolution
  • Lead/Participate  in quarterly Risk Meetings with the BCS functional teams
  • Prepare Risk Report and other custom/ ad hoc reporting
  • Monitor adherence to internal policies requirements e.g. Standing Order  exceptions and resolution
  • Communicate/train BCS teams on new/changes to internal policies/requirements (as required)
  • Support the Manager in change management initiatives, standardization, simplification and automation related to assigned work streams such as Control Inventory/Coverage and CM/Enterprise alignment

 
What you need to succeed?
Must-have

  • Bachelor\'s degree or equivalent in a relevant field
  • 2-3 years’ experience in Capital Markets Broker / Dealer Operations
  • Strong Verbal and written communication skills
  • Strong time management, organizational skills and the ability to work collaboratively
  • Strong analytical and logical problem solving skills, ability to work independently and is results and execution focused.
  • Medium to High proficiency level across Microsoft suite of products: Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Visio.
  • Nice-to-Have:
  • Operational risk/control or Auditing experiences within a Bank or Broker Dealer environment
  • Data Management skills/experiences

 
What’s in it for you?
We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

  • A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits, competitive compensation
  • Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities 
  • Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team
  • Opportunities to do challenging work
  • Flexible work/life balance options

item.title: Senior Data Analyst
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Senior Data Analyst

Job Description

WHAT IS THE OPPORTUNITY?

Partners with the Global Credit business, IT and stakeholders across the organization to analyze and establish requirements, documentation and testing for all data initiatives. This role requires a dynamic individual who will contribute to an existing proactive and successful team, focused on providing timely and creative technology solutions to our business and technology strategy. Role is for an experienced analyst, communicator and coordinator who will be a part of, and support, the Global Credit team in pursuing innovative and strategic technology solutions and evolving its (best) practices.

WHAT WILL YOU DO?

  • Elicit, analyze and document business requirements, business rules and data sources, and work with development and testing teams throughout system implementation and delivery
  • Investigate business requirements, information requests and production issues
  • Responsible for the creation and maintenance of requirement documents such as application specifications and data mappings
  • Coordinate with the data team, business and stakeholders across the enterprise on data sourcing requirements
  • Facilitate the build and maintenance of designs and data models, by incorporating feedback and recommendations from the data team and technical lead
  • Facilitate group meetings for technical design, decision making, problem solving and task implementation
  • Participate and assist with testing, configuration/release management, deployment, and post implementation verification (PIV)
  • Help to support, maintain and debug existing production applications

WHAT DO YOU NEED TO SUCCEED?

 Must have:

  • Previous senior IT development / business lead analysis & coordination experience
  • Experience profiling data within an RDBMS (Sybase, MS SQL, DB2, Oracle) using SQL
  • Understanding of application data store concepts, ETL processes using IBM’s Datastage and Unix scripting
  • Demonstrated ability in written and oral communication skills along with strong presentation skills. Ability to determine the information and communication needs of the stakeholders and project.
  • Strong organizational, project management and time management capabilities.

Nice-to-have

  • Experience with the Corporate Lending business and Credit / Lending Based Applications
  • Experience in a matrix environment, such as a large, publicly-traded corporation
  • Strategic thinker with excellent interpersonal skills to work across functions and businesses

What’s in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper.
