item.title: Senior Analyst, Enterprise Model Risk Management - GRM
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Senior Analyst, Enterprise Model Risk Management - GRM

Job Description

What is the opportunity?  

As Senior Analyst, Enterprise Model Risk Management (EMRM) in our Group Risk Management (GRM) team, you will execute and document validation of the Bank’s enterprise-wide credit risk rating systems and methodologies, with focus on Wholesale and Retail credit risk systems including risk quantification used in both regulatory and economic capital. You will develop and implement tools and methodologies required to underpin credit risk systems and parameters validation, and provide insightful robust analyses of credit risk systems including risk quantification validation.

What will you do? 

  • Perform ongoing credit risk systems, including Wholesale criteria paper models, and parameters validation; and provide insightful analysis of validation results
  • Execute and document appropriate quantitative and qualitative tests, review of the logic and conceptual soundness of credit risk rating systems/wholesale criteria paper models/parameters and their inputs, accuracy, sensitivity, scenario and back testing, benchmarking and
  • Investigate and evaluate data filtering and data quality, relating to credit risk system validation
  • Develop and enhance approaches tailored to timelines and data availability, utilizing detailed or 80/20 solutions, and quantitative and/or qualitative approaches, as appropriate
  • Review and document compliance with the minimum requirements for the Basel AIRB approach and model policy
  • Keep abreast of advances in credit risk validation analytics
  • Complete ad hoc analytical or empirical projects

What do you need to succeed?

Must-have  

  • Graduate degree in a quantitative discipline such as statistics, econometrics, finance or mathematics, and/or a relevant professional qualification
  • Strong knowledge of quantitative validation and vetting techniques
  • Strong computer skills - SAS, SQL and Excel required; Python and MatLab strongly preferred
  • Ability to work with numerous data and IT infrastructures
  • Strong conceptual, analytical, and problem solving skills

Nice-to-have 

  • Ability to communicate, verbally and in writing, complex concepts to a non-technical audience
  • Exposure to credit risk system design and Basel parameter estimation is an asset.
  • Works well in teams 

What’s in it for you?  

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

  • A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits and competitive compensation

  • Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities

  • Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team

  • Opportunities to do challenging work

You will develop and implement tools and methodologies required to underpin credit risk systems and parameters validation, and provide insightful robust analyses of credit risk systems including risk quantification validation.

item.title: Manager, AML Data Management
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Manager, AML Data Management

Job Description

 

 WHAT IS THE OPPORTUNITY?  

The AML Data Management team is mandated to execute the Enterprise AML and Financial Crimes Data Management Program that will govern data used within the enterprise to meet regulatory requirements and expectations, while accommodating RBC’s innovation framework.  You will contribute to sustaining and enhancing the oversight and governance of data used within key processes of the AML and Financial Crimes (such as sanctions screening and transaction monitoring).  You will have an opportunity to liaise with AML Compliance, AML FIU, the Chief Data Office, DNA, and other business partners to execute data management strategies and protocols to maintain and enhance an effective and efficient AML and Financial Crimes Program at RBC.

WHAT WILL YOU DO?  

  • Analyze large data sets in conjunction with data dictionaries, system documentation, and end user documentation to understand business context and translate into data requirements from an enterprise AML Program perspective
  • Perform data profiling and analysis of data sources to assess data availability and ensure AML data requirements are continually satisfied
  • Perform comprehensive data analysis to measure data quality in accordance with the CDO data quality strategy. Define data quality rules and scorecards for ongoing monitoring and measurement of data quality, particularly from an AML Program perspective
  • Evaluate data quality measurements and scorecards to identify data quality issues that may impact the effectiveness of the AML Program. Leverage enterprise data governance tools to document detailed data lineage and data transformations through liaison between business stakeholders and IT partners
  • Perform post implementation verification to ensure AML data requirements from data sources have been accurately and successfully captured in target data models/schemas
  • Assist with the development of high level plans and user stories for completion of AML data requirements and acceptance phases of projects, improving in the level of detail and accuracy of estimates over time

WHAT DO YOU NEED TO SUCCEED?

 Must have

  • Undergraduate degree coupled with change management experience in complex programs with high frequency of requests and multiple priorities
  • 5+ years of technical experience using SQL to interface with various databases, data sources, and file systems (RBDMS, OLTP/OLAP, flat files, UNIX, HDFS)
  • Understanding of data governance and data quality concepts and processes such as Data Quality Controls, Authoritative Data Sources, Master and Reference Data, etc.
  • Proficient with SAS programming and its macro language to perform quantitative data analysis and transformations.  Other expertise with R, Hadoop, VBA, Java and C++  or other related experience desirable
  • Deadline-driven and results-oriented; able to meet consistently high quality standards while handling a variety of tasks and deadlines simultaneously

Nice-to-have

  • Knowledge of reconciliation design, data integration, data sourcing, data quality reporting, and exception resolution processes. As well as knowledge of data warehousing, front-to-back data flows and processing in banking database systems
  • Ability to facilitate between and influence key decision makers
  • Strategic thinker with excellent interpersonal skills to work across functions and businesses
  • Certified Anti-Money Laundering Specialist (CAMS) designation or other related certifications

What’s in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

  • Flexible work/life balance options

item.title: Director, Cards Credit Strategy
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Director, Cards Credit Strategy

Job Description

What is the opportunity?

RBC’s Portfolio Management & Credit Strategy team is seeking a Director, Cards Credit Strategy.  In this critical and specialized role you will drive portfolio growth and customer satisfaction through the design, recommendation and management of effective credit scoring and risk-based strategies to optimize the growth of RBC’s credit card business.

What will you do?

  • Support the Cards and Payment Solutions business targets for balance growth, activation and market share while maintaining the bank’s level of risk appetite.
  • Lead a team to develop and manage credit scoring strategy for new accounts and monitor new account performance
  • Manage credit losses, approval rates and activation to approved targets
  • Manage stakeholders through strategy change and approval process
  • Lead and develop a team of highly talented credit risk professionals
  • Foster thought leadership around credit card design and strategy. Evaluate new research to develop new methodologies and tools to enhance models and strategies

What do you need to succeed?

Must-have

  • At least 8 years’ financial services experience with a complete understanding of risk, finance and the issues specific to credit granting in a credit card environment
  • Expert knowledge of credit principles and risk management methodologies including credit scoring models and their application in account acquisition
  • Quantitative analytics background with a deep knowledge of advanced statistical tools (ex. SAS and SQL) and proven storytelling/presentation skills using PowerPoint.
  • Strategic knowledge of credit card acquisition channels
  • Proven leadership in fostering teamwork, cross-unit and cross-functional cooperation
  • Demonstrated intellectual curiosity and passion for exploring data to derive insights
  • An undergraduate degree in a quantitative field of study

RBC is committed to supporting flexible work arrangements when and where available. Details to be discussed with Hiring Manager.

RBC requires as a condition of employment that all successful candidates in the United States and Canada be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 prior to their start date, and may require proof of the same. Reasonable accommodation is available where required by law.

What’s in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

  • A comprehensive Total Rewards Program of flexible benefits, unlimited commission pay, and pension options

item.title: Associate Director - Enterprise Model Risk Management
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Associate Director - Enterprise Model Risk Management

Job Description

What is the opportunity?  

As Associate Director, Enterprise Model Risk Management (EMRM) in our Group Risk Management (GRM) team, you will execute and document validation of the Bank’s enterprise-wide credit risk rating systems and methodologies, with focus on Retail and Wholesale credit risk systems including wholesale, retail, and margin lending parameters (Probability of Default (“PD”), Loss given Default (“LGD”) and Exposure at Default (“EAD”)) used in both regulatory and economic capital. You will develop and implement tools and methodologies required to underpin credit risk systems and parameters validation, and provide insightful robust analyses of credit risk systems including risk quantification validation.

What will you do? 

  • Perform ongoing Retail and Wholesale credit risk systems including parameters validations and provide insightful analysis of validation results
  • Perform a wide range of data reconciliations and analyses, e.g. organizing, interpreting and analyzing data using various statistical techniques catered for validation purposes   
  • Execute and document appropriate quantitative and qualitative tests, review of the logic and conceptual soundness of credit risk rating systems, parameters and their inputs, accuracy, sensitivity, back testing, benchmarking etc.
  • Develop and enhance approaches tailored to timelines and data availability, utilizing detailed or 80/20 solutions, and quantitative and/or qualitative approaches, as appropriate
  • Deliver validation findings and elicit feedback and remediation action plans / solutions from model stakeholders
  • Ensure project and risk objectives are accomplished within approved timeframes and complied with regulatory requirements, model risk policy and model operating standards

What do you need to succeed?

Must-have  

  • Graduate degree in a quantitative discipline such as computer science/information system, statistics, econometrics and/or a relevant professional qualification
  • Understand various data system structures/processes and how they affect the inputs and outputs of credit risk validation data
  • Strong conceptual, analytical, detailed oriented and problem solving skills
  • Strong computer skills - SAS, SQL and Excel required; Python and MatLab are essential
  • Ability to work with enormous data and various IT infrastructures
  • Execute with urgency while maintaining quality and efficiency
  • Adapt to shifting priorities, coupled with a sense of urgency
  • Works well in teams   
  • 2+ years of analytical and quantitative experience with a financial institution, in a related role such as a model developer/validator, data miner/analyst, or a risk manager   

Nice-to-have 

  • Ability to communicate, verbally and in writing, complex concepts to a non-technical audience
  • Ability to work in Unix, Teradata Data Warehouse and/or Hive Data Lake environments
  • Exposure to credit risk system design and Basel parameter estimation is an asset
  • Proactive learning and working skills

What’s in it for you?  

  • We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. item.title: Manager, Business Strategy & Insights
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Manager, Business Strategy & Insights

Job Description

What is the opportunity?

Aligned with RBC’s commitment to drive new client growth, you will be responsible for developing insights and recommendations, which will transform how we make decisions to drive acquisition & retention across the portfolio, while maximizing the client experience as well as organizational value. In this role, you will report to the Senior Manager, Client Growth and Acquisition , and be a member of a dynamic, collaborative, and high-performing team, where you will be expected to contribute to team culture, consistent with the RBC Leadership Model.

What will you do?

Portfolio Analysis and Increased Client Acquisition (70%)

• Conduct portfolio analysis on various products (HP, LP, BP and BLIP) to create a fact base to better understand client and prospect behavior, including insights to support better decision making to achieve our client growth targets

• Generate insights based on distribution productivity, to support enablement with business growth objectives

• Develop reporting and presentations, and effectively communicating data-driven insights, opportunities and recommendations 

Relationship Management (30%)

• Collaborate with key partners across the organization to gather data/ insights to advance our client growth targets. Key partners include, but are not limited to teams within Creditor Insurance (Product, Enablement, Digital, Retention, Analytics), RBC Insurance (Marketing, Technology, Risk, Operations, Underwriters, Research), and P&CB (key stakeholders from various lines of business such as Home Equity Financing, Personal Lending, Cards, Business Financial Services)

What will you need to succeed?

• Minimum 3-4 years of relevant experience

• Innovative and analytical thinker with the ability to process complex information and exercise sound judgment,

• Business acumen

• Ability to quickly adapt to changing circumstances and competing priorities

• Ability to participate on diverse cross-functional teams and/ provide input

• Strong Excel and Tableau skill sets

What\'s in it for you?

• A Total Rewards program that includes flexible benefits, work/life balance and career development programs and investment and retirement savings plans

• Competitive pay and high-earning potential

• All the tools, training, and team support you need to grow your career

• Flexible work/life balance options

• Sophisticated RBCI software tools to boost your productivity

RBC is committed to supporting flexible work arrangements when and where available. Details to be discussed with Hiring Manager.

RBC requires as a condition of employment that all successful candidates in the United States and Canada be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 prior to their start date, and may require proof of the same. Reasonable accommodation is available where required by law.

Job Summary

Aligned with RBC’s commitment to drive new client growth, you will be responsible for developing insights and recommendations, which will transform how we make decisions to drive acquisition & retention across the portfolio, while maximizing the client experience as well as organizational value. In this role, you will report to the Senior Manager, Client Growth and Acquisition , and be a member of a dynamic, collaborative, and high-performing team, where you will be expected to contribute to team culture, consistent with the RBC Leadership Model.

item.title: Manager, Performance Management
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Manager, Performance Management

Job Description

  • Planview/MIS administration for Finance IT’s development/maintenance portfolio of $100mm+, including the creation/upkeep/closure of projects, population of key data attributes, and ensuring proper cost recovery
  • Prepare and own product-aligned financial reporting,  total cost of ownership (TCO) analysis, and capacity vs. demand model, while periodically updating the data tables required to drive analysis
  • Reconcile contractor cost recoveries in Planview/MIS to professional fee accrual during month-end at the contract and resource level
  • Ensure full time employees and contractors are fully recovered monthly and co-ordinate with other PMs and PCOs prior to month end for shared resources (ie. Management, Architecture)
  • Support PM and delivery leads in managing all aspects of financials (monitoring of actuals vs plan, forecasting, processing of invoices)
  • Support executive and portfolio level financial/KPI reporting
  • Automate existing reporting and enhance data visualization/analytics through various productivity tools (Tableau, VBA, etc); develop new automated solutions to improve productivity and efficiency
  • Maintain proper product allocations to all resources and management level/overhead
  • Maintain a healthy, accurate financial control environment within the Finance IT Business Management Office, reinforcing our role as the source of financial truth (App Dev, Maintenance, 3rd Party, NIE, etc)
  • Monitoring and communicating key performance metrics and operational challenges.

item.title: Sr. Manager, Reporting & Visualization
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Sr. Manager, Reporting & Visualization

Job Description

What is the opportunity?
 
Reporting to the Director of Strategic Initiatives, the Sr. Manager, Reporting & Visualization is responsible for leading advanced, self-service reporting and data visualization capabilities and interactive dashboards supporting key business initiatives.
The candidate will lead Reporting & Visualization deliverables and be part of the overall R&V practice within the WM Analytics & Innovation team. This includes working in an agile product team, leading the design, development, implementation, and support internally developed reporting and analytical tools, including advanced dashboards. The Sr. Manager of R&V will work with other Wealth Management partners to support and consult on their reporting and visualization activities.
 

What will you do?

  • Support the WM Analytics & Innovation leadership in the design, coordination, execution and monitoring of key transformational initiatives across the group in support of the WM Analytics & Innovation Target Operating Model.

  • Develop best-in class reporting, analytics, visualization and dashboards for the Wealth Management business through innovative solutions.

  • Understand the Wealth Management reporting & visualization needs by actively working in an agile product team.

  • Provide thought leadership on how analytics initiatives can help achieve business goals and provide advice and guidance on how to take action based on the customer context and analytical findings through leading reporting & visualization activities.

  • Support the execution and evolution of the WM Analytics & Innovation Strategy and Target Operating Model (including the technology roadmap), partnering with WM/Enterprise/IT partners to design the future state.

  • Contribute to the effectiveness of WM Analytics & Innovation and its processes, deliverables, metrics, benchmarking and reporting; identifies and champions/implements opportunities to enhance coordination and efficiency within team processes.

Must Haves:

  • 3 -5 years Tableau Development Experience

  • Experience with assisting and participating in data validation and cleaning to ensure the quality and integrity of data.

  • Experience with analyzing and extracting key data and information to meet the organization\'s information system needs and requirements.

  • Strong Communication and Presentation skills to varying levels of seniority (including executives)

  • Experience working in an Agile environment

  • Prior experience in Financial Services

Nice to haves:

  • Experience or designation in agile/ project management (PMP, CSM, CSPO), database administration or other data-intensive areas

  • Prior Experience in Wealth or Global Asset Management

  • Experience with Python, R, Java, C, Hadoop & related technologies

  • Master’s degree in Software Engineering, Statistics, Finance or equivalent

RBC is committed to supporting flexible work arrangements when and where available. Details to be discussed with Hiring Manager.

RBC requires as a condition of employment that all successful candidates in the United States and Canada be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 prior to their start date, and may require proof of the same. Reasonable accommodation is available where required by law. 

Job Summary

• Reporting to the Director of Strategic Initiatives, the Sr. Manager, Reporting & Visualization is responsible for leading advanced, self-service reporting and data visualization capabilities and interactive dashboards supporting key business initiatives.
• The candidate will lead Reporting & Visualization deliverables and be part of the overall R&V practice within the WM Analytics & Innovation team. This includes working in an agile product team, leading the design, development, implementation, and support internally developed reporting and analytical tools, including advanced dashboards.
• The Sr. Manager of R&V will work with other Wealth Management partners to support and consult on their reporting and visualization activities.
